  • Constructor Details

    • FlightBoard

      public FlightBoard(int numPlayers, int boardSize, Bank bank, Game g)
      Constructs a FlightBoard object.
      Parameters:
      numPlayers - the number of players participating in the game.
      boardSize - the size of the board used in the game.
      bank - the Bank object used for handling in-game transactions.
      g - the Game object representing the game logic and state.

  • Method Details

    • getDoubledplayers

      public ArrayList<Player> getDoubledplayers()
      Retrieves the list of players whose points or attributes have been doubled.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of Player objects representing the doubled players.

    • resetDoubledPlayers

      public void resetDoubledPlayers()
      Resets the list of players who are currently doubled. This method clears the current state of the doubled players by reinitializing the `doubledplayers` list as a new, empty ArrayList.

    • getPlayerRankList

      public ArrayList<Player> getPlayerRankList()
      Retrieves the list of players sorted by their rank.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing Player objects ordered by rank.

    • getNumPlayers

      public int getNumPlayers()
      Retrieves the current number of players.
      Returns:
      the number of players as an integer.

    • getDecksInTheHandofOthers

      public ArrayList<Deck> getDecksInTheHandofOthers()
      Retrieves the list of decks that are currently in the hands of other players.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Deck objects representing the decks held by other players.

      public Game getMygame()
      Retrieves the current game object associated with this instance.
      Returns:
      the instance of the Game object referred to as mygame

    • getShowableDecks

      public List<Deck> getShowableDecks()
      Retrieves the list of decks that can be shown or displayed.
      Returns:
      a list of Deck objects that are eligible to be shown

    • initializePlayerPos

      public void initializePlayerPos(Player player, int position, int startingRank) throws Exception
      Initializes the player's position on the game board and assigns the player to a specific ranking. Validates the position and rank before proceeding, and updates the game board and player properties. If an invalid position or rank is provided, an event is triggered to handle incorrect input.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose position and rank are to be initialized.
      position - The position on the board where the player is to be placed. Must be within valid board boundaries.
      startingRank - The starting rank to which the player should be assigned. Must be a valid and unique rank.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during player initialization or the position and rank are invalid.

    • getBank

      public Bank getBank()
      Retrieves the Bank instance associated with this object.
      Returns:
      the Bank instance

    • getPlayerRank

      public int getPlayerRank(Player player)
      Retrieves the rank of the specified player within the playerRank list.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player object whose rank is to be retrieved
      Returns:
      the player's rank index if found; -1 if the player is not present in the playerRank list

    • getRanking

      public ArrayList<Player> getRanking()
      Retrieves the ranking of players as an ArrayList.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Player objects representing the current player rankings.

    • removePlayerinPosition

      public void removePlayerinPosition(Player player, int position) throws RuntimeException
      Removes a player from the specified position on a game board.
      Parameters:
      player - The player object to be removed.
      position - The position of the player on the board to be removed. Must be within valid board bounds.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the specified position is out of bounds.

    • getPlayerNameFromPos

      public String getPlayerNameFromPos(int pos, ArrayList<Player> play) throws RuntimeException
      Retrieves the username of a player based on their position on the board.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position on the board to look for.
      play - The list of players to search through.
      Returns:
      The username of the player at the specified position. Returns "NOT FOUND" if no player is found at the given position.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an unexpected error occurs during the operation.

    • getShowableDeck

      public Deck getShowableDeck(int position) throws RuntimeException
      Retrieves a deck that can be displayed based on the specified position.
      Parameters:
      position - the position of the deck to be retrieved
      Returns:
      the deck at the specified position that is eligible to be shown
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the operation is not supported or any error occurs during retrieval

    • getBoardSize

      public int getBoardSize()
      Retrieves the size of the board.
      Returns:
      the size of the board as an integer

    • advanceRank

      public void advanceRank(Player player) throws Exception
      Advances the rank of the specified player by swapping their position with the player directly above them in the ranking list. If the player is already at the top of the list, no changes are made.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose rank is to be advanced.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the specified player is not found in the ranking list.

    • lowerRank

      public void lowerRank(Player player) throws Exception
      Demotes the rank of the specified player in the ranking system. If the player is not found or is already at the lowest rank, an appropriate action is taken.
      Parameters:
      player - the player whose rank is to be lowered
      Throws:
      Exception - if the player is not found in the ranking system

    • movePlayer

      public void movePlayer(Player player, int number) throws Exception
      Moves the specified player forward or backward on the game board based on the given number.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player object representing the player to be moved
      number - an integer indicating how many spaces the player should move; a positive number moves the player forward, and a negative number moves the player backward
      Throws:
      Exception - if any error occurs during the movement process

    • getPlayerfromID

      public Player getPlayerfromID(int ID)
      Retrieves a Player object from the player rank list based on the provided player ID.
      Parameters:
      ID - the unique identifier of the player to be retrieved
      Returns:
      the Player object corresponding to the provided ID if it exists in the rank list
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if no player with the given ID is found in the rank list

    • getBoard

      public ArrayList<Integer> getBoard()
      Retrieves the current state of the board.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of integers representing the board state.

    • getPlayerwithbestShip

      public Player getPlayerwithbestShip()
      Identifies the player with the best ship based on the number of exposed connectors. The method iterates through a list of players, comparing their ships' exposed connectors. The player with the fewest exposed connectors is determined to have the best ship. If the list is empty, the method will return null.
      Returns:
      The player with the best ship, or null if no players are available.
